intro: Paraspalathus incurva, commonly known as the spiral-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its spirally arranged leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is often found in open woodlands. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
